Why only boys? Why not girls? Although I do appreciate the culture where this project is taking place (I am Latin American myself), I do not like the specific gender roles of the 'mother' and the 'father' that reinforces stereotypes. Why not to help boys and girls from the beginning? Why not giving the 'mother' and the 'father' more diverse roles from start? Changes (cultural ones in particular) are usually more painful and difficult when made/introduced later in most processes.

Of course, I am sure that these children are much better off being there than they would otherwise and, for that, my full appreciation to you Destin and everyone else involved. After all, you are doing something about it while many of us are only 'criticising'. I like to think though that it is not simple criticism. I think that when most people discover something good, they want to preserve it; to be better. I certainly do.

I worked almost a year on a place for handicapped children that had the same principle: we had a "house dad" and "house mom", workers were bog brothers and sisters, it was a makeshift family. It worked WONDERS. We all slept in the same house, it was 24h "job", one free day per week ( i did work once 3 months straight thou, that was tough, mentally..).

A lot of the kids were there because their parent either did not want or were incapable of taking care of them, pre-natal alcohol was very big factor. So they had pretty awful homes but when they got in to that warm, loving new "family".. man.. it brings tears to my eyes even now. They visible, literally opened up, their tight inwards pose, hands tucked to chest, turning away... Two months and same kid was running with open arms (allthou he never learned to express love when i was there, i was pretty bruised but if that's what you have to do, take few punches and a hug from 8 year old, it's ok..).

Note, it does not have to be mom and dad, any grownups on any number of them, just the family structure people who love you and will no abandon you no matter what. That is family. Most likely in that place, it has to be mom and dad to avoid problems with locals.. Progress is steady but slow on those issues. And i don't really care when it's this good.
